column4: can anyone please tell how to create a wireless network through terminal?
`man wireless` explains the most import stuff/references
not through command line -> use network manager applet
: Yes i did but I didnt find any suitable commands for that
you need /etc/network/interfaces for permanent connections or iwconfig/iwpriv for manual stuff from the cli
iwlist scans network, iwconfig sets wireless stuff (iwconfig -h) and dhclient/ifconfig sets IP stuff onto the adapter
the manual pages of these commands refer to other wireless related commands aswell... dive into it :)
: Okay, I will look into that now..

`iwconfig` will list your wireless devices, iwconfig <device> essid <ap> key <ap> etc. will bring up the wireless network, don't forget to put IP over it with ifconfig (static) or dhclient (dhcp), etc. ... it's quiet easy, but to be honest I use nm-apllet these days :P
: When i give iwconfig, its telling that no wireless extensions are there for l0 and eth0..does that mean that my wireless driver has to have these extensions?
lo is loopback, eth0 is the first ethernet device, etc. if there isn't any wireless adapter listed, check `lspci` and if the correct kernel module is loaded
does your adapter work within the graphical environment? if true -> it'll work on the shell aswell
: How can I check whether the correct kernel module is loaded or not/
just check `lspci |grep -i network` and check if your card is listed @ https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/WirelessCardsSupported :) thx yagoo
